Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2013 04:31AM - edited Aug 1, 2013 04:33AM by LaurenN Yes there are hard areas....perfect example was many years ago...30 to be exact...I had a lump where examination and needle only showed hard mass. Surgery (removal of lump) showed benign lump there and also other breast at that time.....it was hard in that area always ...even after all that time scar tissue in that spot. Scar tissue is tough stuff. PS. My diagnostic mammo /ultra was originally Aug 6....due to opening I got in today....so relieved....but of course they don't tell you anything....this was for a couple of areas totally different than what I mentioned above..now have to wait until Aug 13 for doctor appointment as they send her any results....and she is on vacation next week so can't hear anything any sooner.

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2013 02:13PM LaurenN wrote: Beesie, I'm in Canada....there is no mention of a BIRADS rating on the results form, just description, findings and opinion. This is a dedicated breast assessment clinic at a large hospital...maybe not all provinces use the rating ?? Lolasimply....got copy of results from doctor...test results for both mammogram and ultrasound were on same sheet. I wouldn't have asked for a copy if I hadn't been reading all the good to know information posted in comments on this website.......so I'm very happy to have a record.
